definitions.definition: A direct popular vote on a proposed law or constitutional amendment . (The adposition on is usually used before the related subject of the vote.)
An action, choice, etc., which is perceived as passing judgment on another matter.
examples: My father is taking my decision on whether to go to university as a referendum on his performance as a parent, and it's very stressful.

main_definition: ( politics ) A direct popular vote on a proposed law or constitutional amendment . (The adposition on is usually used before the related subject of the vote.)
secondary_definitions: An action, choice, etc., which is perceived as passing judgment on another matter.
